jot.communication

Interface Communicator


  • public interface Communicator
    Interface that defines the core methods to implement a networking module that runs over a communication grid.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean exitedZone(org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D pastPosition, org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D presentPosition)
      Test if a player given its past and current positions has exited a zone or not.

      Given a point p1 obtain the closest baryCenter.

      Test if this node is the only one in the grid.
      void sendUpdate(GameUpdate gameUpdate, boolean exitedZone)
      Send an GameUpdate to all players in players hash table if the local player did not left the zone otherwise send a remove request to its monitor, find the new closest monitor and set it as this player node monitor, request the new monitor to send all is players data and their direct neighbor monitors to do the same.

    • Method Detail

      • setZonesBaryCenters

        void setZonesBaryCenters()
        Initialize the zone coordinates for each value of the array baryCenters with dimensions zonesLength and zonesWidth (number of tiles in z and x).

      • getClosestZoneBaryCenter

        org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getClosestZoneBaryCenter(org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D position)
        Given a point p1 obtain the closest baryCenter.
        Parameters:
        position - position of an player or a baryCenter value
        Returns:
        the baryCenter which is closer to p1

      • getZonesLength

        int getZonesLength()
        Get the zones length.
        Returns:
        the number of zones in x.

      • getZonesWidth

        int getZonesWidth()
        Get the zones width.
        Returns:
        the number of zones in y.

      • exitedZone

        boolean exitedZone(org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D pastPosition,
                   org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D presentPosition)
        Test if a player given its past and current positions has exited a zone or not.
        Parameters:
        pastPosition - the past position of a given player.
        presentPosition - the present position of a given player.
        Returns:
        TRUE if player exited a zone, FALSE otherwise.

      • toRemove

        boolean toRemove(org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D position,
                 GameUpdate gameUpdate)
        Given a player A current position (point p) and a game update with the position of a remote player B, if B is outside A AOI then if in A scene B should be removed.
        Parameters:
        position - a local player current position.
        gameUpdate - a remote player game update.
        Returns:
        TRUE if player should be removed from scene, FALSE otherwise.

      • startGridNode

        void startGridNode(String gridConfig)
        Setup grid node.
        Parameters:
        gridConfig - location of .xml with the grid configuration to use.

      • stopGridNode

        void stopGridNode()
        Stop this grid node and remove event listeners.

      • isOnlyGridNode

        boolean isOnlyGridNode()
        Test if this node is the only one in the grid.
        Returns:
        TRUE if only one node in the grid, FALSE otherwise.

      • isGridNodeStarted

        boolean isGridNodeStarted()
        Verify if the method startGridNode successfully finished, i.e., if this node is initialized and running.
        Returns:
        TRUE if node initialized and running, FALSE otherwise.

      • isGridRunning

        boolean isGridRunning()
        Verify if the method startGridNode successfully finished, i.e., if this node is initialized and running, and if this in not the only available grid node.
        Returns:
        TRUE if node initialized and running and the number of grid nodes greater than 1 otherwise return FALSE.

      • getLocalNodeId

        Object getLocalNodeId()
        Get this grid node ID.
        Returns:
        a grid node ID.

      • getPlayerNodesCount

        float getPlayerNodesCount()
        Return the total number of playerNodes in the grid.
        Returns:
        the total number of playerNodes in the grid.

      • getPerceivedPlayerNodesCount

        float getPerceivedPlayerNodesCount()
        Return the number of playerNodes perceived by this player node.
        Returns:
        the number of playerNodes perceived by this player node.

      • sendUpdate

        void sendUpdate(GameUpdate gameUpdate,
                boolean exitedZone)
        Send an GameUpdate to all players in players hash table if the local player did not left the zone otherwise send a remove request to its monitor, find the new closest monitor and set it as this player node monitor, request the new monitor to send all is players data and their direct neighbor monitors to do the same. Regardless if local player left or not the zone, the final operation of this method is to send the provided gameUpdate to the local player's monitor.
        Parameters:
        gameUpdate - provided local player gameUpdate.
        exitedZone - boolean that is either true if zone changed or false otherwise.

      • sendUpdate

        void sendUpdate(GameUpdate gameUpdate,
                Object destinationNodeId)
        Send a game update to a provided destination node.
        Parameters:
        gameUpdate - GameUpdate to send.
        destinationNodeId - target node to GameUpdate, if NULL multicast to all other grid nodes is sent instead.

      • update

        void update(float dt)
        Process all received gameUpdates.
        Parameters:
        dt - the amount of elapsed game time since the last frame.
